places.name: Frederik Meijer Gardens
places.notes: Beautiful gardens and sculptures. On summer nights, they have concerts in the amphitheater. Tuesdays evenings are free.
places.address: Frederik Meijer Gardens and Sculpture Park, 1000, East Beltline Avenue Northeast, Grand Rapids, Kent County, Michigan, 49525, United States

places.name: John Ball Zoo
places.notes: A great zoo with a variety of animals. It's a great place to take kids or just enjoy a day outdoors. Recommended: check out the porcupine - he's a mad lad.
places.parking: Free - Huge lot with plenty of space.
places.address: 1300 West Fulton Street, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Grand Rapids Art Museum
places.notes: A modern art museum with a variety of exhibits. It's a great place to spend an afternoon.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 101 Monroe Center St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Grand Rapids Public Museum
places.notes: A museum with exhibits on the history of Grand Rapids and the surrounding area.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 272 Pearl St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Woodrows Duckpin Bowling
places.notes: A unique bowling experience with duckpin bowling. Games are very short and quick and it's attached in the Amway Grand Hotel.
places.parking: Just walk - it's in the hotel!
places.address: 200 Lyon St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Sixth Street Park
places.notes: A small park with a playground and picnic area. It's a great place to relax and enjoy the outdoors right on the edge of downtown. There is a dam here that you'll likely see fisherman at. PLEASE NOTE: THE RAPIDS ARE VERY STRONG HERE AND REGARDED AS AN EXTREMLY DANGEROUS DAM. But there are fish there....
places.parking: A parking lot is available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 647 Monroe Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: More or Less - alcohol-free bottle shop
places.notes: A unique shop offering a variety of alcohol-free beverages. It's a great place to find non-alcoholic options for those who prefer them. Their selection is the best in the city BY FAR and the staff is super friendly and ready with a recommendation. Cannabis drinks can be found here as well, and they are rare in the city. Recommendation from Joe: Try the DROM (they have some for tasting).
places.address: 434 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Big Mini Putt Club
places.notes: A fun indoor mini golf course with a variety of holes. It's a great place for groups of 2-5 to chill out.
places.address: 70 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Gimme's Par and Grill
places.notes: An indoor golf simulator and grill. I have not been here, but it comes highly recommended by a friend.
places.address: 45 Ottawa Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Grand Rapids Children's Museum
places.notes: A fun and interactive museum for kids. It's a great place to take children and let them explore and learn.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 11 Sheldon Ave NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Put Putts Bar
places.notes: A typical west-side bar with a relaxed atmosphere and great staff. Two patios (covered and open air) and solid food.
places.parking: Small parking lot, but it's very close to the bus stop for the laker line.
places.address: 1148 Fulton St W, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

events.description: General trivia night. Team size is generally under 6 people.

places.name: Monarchs Corner Bar
places.notes: A popular live music venue with a bar. They host a variety of events and concerts.
places.parking: Small parking lot available, but street parking is also an option.
places.address: 646 Stocking Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

events.description: A smaller open mic to a bar of good folks. Very cramped - but a great time. Singer songwriter style of open mic, but all are welcome.

places.name: The Pyramid Scheme
places.notes: A live music venue and bar with several pinball machines. They have a variety of events and concerts.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 68 Commerce Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: House Rules
places.notes: A bar with a relaxed atmosphere, known for its board games and trivia nights. They have a good selection of beers and cocktails.The park across the street is a bit sketchy, but not dangerous.
places.address: 404 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: One Burbon
places.notes: A typical bar with a great selection of bourbons and whiskeys. Probably the best selection in the city and fairly affordable for the quality.
places.address: 608 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Drip Drop Cocktail Room
places.notes: A small coctail bar, known for its unique drinks. It can fill up quickly - or be empty, depending on the night.
places.address: 445 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Mulligan's Pub
places.notes: The kind of bar where your feet stick to the floor. Cheap PBR and decent selection of bottles/cans. Filled with regulars who know each other, this place is . Monday is Trivia night which 'is vulgar and not for the faint of heart', but great fun if you can handle some crude humor.
places.address: 1518 Wealthy St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506

events.description: Vulgar and not for the faint of heart, but great fun if you can handle some crude humor.

places.name: Fulton Street Pub
places.notes: A bar with lots of open space and a nice patio. They have a decent selection of bottled beers and a few taps - but the food is the real draw.
places.address: 801 Fulton St W, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

events.description: Clean trivia night with a good atmosphere. Very competititve, teams of 1-6 people. Prizes for the top 2 teams and a consolation prize for a team not in the running in the final question.

places.name: Turnsiles
places.notes: Music themed bar with amazing food and live music most nights. Highly recommend the loaded fries.
places.address: 526 Stocking Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

events.description: A great open mic for singer-songwriters.
A great open mic for singer-songwriters and bands.
How well do you know that tune? Music Bingo is a fun twist where they play the song and you mark it off on a bingo card. This one's easy to play, but hard to beat me at.

places.name: Logan's Alley
places.notes: A bar with great food, darts, and chill vibe. Right across the street from a great Coney Island resturant.
places.parking: Very small parking lot, street parking available.
places.address: 616 Michigan St NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Joey's Tavern
places.notes: A bar with a relaxed atmosphere, known for its board games and trivia nights. They have a good selection of beers and cocktails.
places.address: 1125 Fulton St W, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Broadway Bar
places.notes: A tiny bar with only a few seats. The big draw is that it is christmas themed - like, over the top. It's an experience.
places.address: 740 Broadway Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Social Misfits
places.notes: A cocktail bar that does elevated cocktails and WAFFLES. Yes, waffles.
places.address: 143 Fulton St W, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Founders Brewing Co.
places.notes: Great craft beer and live music on certain nights. It is a very popular spot, but has a large outdoor area.
places.parking: Street parking available, and a parking lot is nearby that can validate 1 hour of parking.
places.address: Market Avenue Southwest, Grand Rapids, Kent County, Michigan, 49503, United States

places.name: Brewery Vivant
places.notes: A brewery located in a former funeral home, known for its Belgian-style beers and farm-to-table food.
places.address: 925 Cherry St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506

places.name: The Mitten Brewing Co.
places.notes: A brewery located in a former firehouse, known for its craft beers and pizza. Recommendation: Get a pizza flight. You get to try many types of pizza and it feeds 3 people at a minimum.
places.address: 527 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Long Road Distillers
places.notes: A distillery with a focus on craft spirits. Recommendation: try their cherry liqueur. They offer tours on Saturdays for $10 that includes a tasting - but you have to book in advance.
places.address: 537 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: City Built Brewing Company
places.notes: A brewery with a focus on Latin-inspired beers and food.
places.address: 820 Monroe Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Harmony Brewing Company
places.notes: A brewery known for its community-focused atmosphere and a variety of craft beers.They have a great outdoor seating area and host a euchre night on Mondays
places.address: 1551 Lake Dr SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506

places.name: Speciation Brewing Company
places.notes: A very good brewery featuring a wide variety of SOURS, Lagers, and Pale Ales. They do not serve food, but they do allow you to bring your own.
places.address: 928 Wealthy St SE, Grand Rapids, MI 49506

places.name: Atwater Brewing
places.notes: Detroit-based brewery with a full kitchen, offering pub fare and a wide selection of craft beers. Spacious, with river views and a lively atmosphere.
places.parking: Street parking and nearby lots available.
places.address: 201 Michigan St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Perrin Brewing Company
places.notes: A brewery with great beers - probably the best in the area. But it's a bit out of the way from downtown. Worth the drive if you need to run errands in the area.
places.address: 5910 Comstock Park Dr NW, Comstock Park, MI 49321

places.name: New Holland Brewing - The Knickerbocker
places.notes: A big brewery with some great beers and seltzers. The food is good, but can be pricey.
places.address: 417 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Kusterer Brauhaus
places.notes: A German-style brewery with a cozy atmosphere and a variety of beers.
places.address: 642 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Rapid River Stillhouse
places.notes: A distillery and brewery offering a unique selection of spirits and beers. Known for its craft cocktails and small-batch brews.
places.address: 401 Stocking Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: The Foolery
places.notes: Detroit style pizza and amazing appetizers. A great place to hang out with friends. Cheap PBRs always.
places.address: 10 Ionia Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
places.parking: Street parking available - but it's downtown. Best to walk.

places.name: Barrio
places.notes: A vibrant Mexican restaurant known for its tacos and tequila selection. This place gets packed before events at Van Andel Arena or the GLC
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: Brush Studio, 11, Ionia Avenue Northwest, Grand Rapids, Kent County, Michigan, 49503, United States

places.name: Tacos El Cunado
places.notes: A taco stand with AMAZING tacos, burritos, and a few other options. It has outdoor seating and is well worth the walk if you're looking for great mexican food.
places.address: 1024 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: HopCat
places.notes: A popular bar and restaurant known for its extensive beer selection and burgers.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 25 Ionia Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Maggie's Kitchen
places.notes: A cozy spot known for its breakfast and brunch options. Recommended option: breakfast burrito.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 636 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Westsider Cafe
places.notes: A cozy cafe known for its breakfast and brunch options. Recommended option: breakfast burrito.This is a solid place for breakfast - but they close early and are not open on Mondays or Tuesdays.
places.parking: Small parking lot available, but street parking is also an option.
places.address: 1180 Walker Ave NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Butcher's Union
places.notes: A steakhouse and bar known for its meat dishes and extensive drink menu. A great place to celebrate a special occasion. Upscale and a bit pricey, but worth it for the quality.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 438 Bridge St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Stella's Lounge
places.notes: A popular spot known for its burgers and craft beer selection. They have a great atmosphere and are dog-friendly.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 53 Commerce Ave SW, Grand Rapids, MI 49503

places.name: Two Scott's Barbecue
places.notes: A small BBQ joint that IS THE BEST IN THE CITY HANDS DOWN NO COMPEITION END OF STORY. They have a small menu, but everything is amazing. The burnt ends go quick - usually gone by noon, but are a must-try.
places.parking: Street parking available, but it's best to walk if you're downtown.
places.address: 536 Leonard St NW, Grand Rapids, MI 49504

places.name: Grand Coney
places.notes: A classic diner known for its coney dogs and breakfast options. A great place for a late-night bite. Open 24 Hours.
places.address: 809 Michigan St NE, Grand Rapids, MI 49503
